info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 12 at 2:55PM PDT until August 13 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HOT...DRY...WINDY...AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS UPCOMING WEEK... .A strong ridge will build in over the region beginning Sunday, with temperatures expected to rise well into the triple digits for most locations west of the Cascades. Dry air will produce low afternoon humidities, and when combined with afternoon and evening winds, critical fire weather conditions are possible. Additionally, dry and unstable conditions could lead to rapid fire growth at the Flat Fire or any other active fires in the area. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM PDT SUNDAY FOR HAINES 6 OVER THE FLAT FIRE FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 619... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY FOR HAINES 6 OVER THE FLAT FIRE FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 619... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 619... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Red Flag Warning over the Flat Fire, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM PDT Sunday, and from 2 PM to 8 PM PDT Monday. A Fire Weather Watch remains in effect for Fire Weather Zone 619 from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Dry and unstable conditions may also lead to rapid fire growth on existing fires. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon...Fire weather zone 619...including the Flat Fire and portions of the Rogue River-Siskiyou National Forest. * WIND...Northwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 20 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * HAINES...6. * ADDITIONAL INFO...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
